pullRequest.body:
I think this probably raises that a more general approach to handling partial inverses is needed soon, since it duplicates lots of the `Matrix` logic.

---

#### Import changes for modified files

</details>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ fst_invOf`
`+ invOf_eq_inv`
`+ invertibleEquivInvertibleFst`
`+ invertibleFstOfInvertible`
`+ invertibleOfInvertibleFst`
`+ isUnit_iff_isUnit_fst`
`+ isUnit_inl_iff`
`+ isUnit_inr_iff`
`+ isUnit_inv_iff`
`+ mul_left_eq_one`
`+ mul_right_eq_one`

<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>



The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11131686100/job/30933818619)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11131686100/job/30933818927)

Can you explain why this whole PR is phrased in terms of `Invertible` and there's no mention of `Units`? I'm probably missing something very obvious. After you explain and I understand I'll have another look.

The pattern here is the same one used by `Matrix`; invertible is useful because it lets you write down the inverse of a specific element, and then the `IsUnit` results follow naturally.

What type of statement about `Units` would you like to see?
That's fine. The existing statements you have about units are sufficient.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(Algebra/TrivSqZeroExt): generalize some results to `Invertible`

source.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(RingTheory/DualNumber): dual numbers over a field are local and PIR
